hook.text: Bernie Sanders calls himself a democratic socialist. In Europe, that's basically a mainstream Social Democrat.

buildup.text: Democratic socialism wants to replace capitalism with a worker-owned economy through democratic means, not revolution.

discovery.text: Unlike communists, democratic socialists reject authoritarian methods. Change must come through elections and debate.

twist.text: In practice, most democratic socialists push policies closer to social democracy: strong welfare, not ending markets.

climax.text: The label carries baggage in America but is normal in Europe. Context shapes how scary a word sounds.

punchline.text: Democratic socialists want big change through ballots, not bullets.

quiz.question: How do democratic socialists differ from communists?
options: They reject authoritarian methods and pursue change through elections
They want a stronger military dictatorship
They oppose all forms of government
